website_summaries.verdict: If you need a stand mixer built for professionals, this is the one to pick. Otherwise, choose the Pro Line for the best that KitchenAid has to offer in a residential model.
pros: A powerful machine designed for commercial use
Boasts a 1.3 HP motor for impressive mixing
Comes with an 8-quart bowl, lift and guard, and ability to work with 12 attachments for every professional mixing job
cons: Very expensive – but it's also an investment that will pay off over time for the professional chef

customer_reviews.title: Have had it for 6 months,daily use.  it stoped working ..., great warranty ,
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for 6 months, it stoped working while i was making pizza dough, at first it seemed really tough,silent, but sometimes make a clicking sound. waiting for warranty since it says it has 2 year warranty. Will keep you updated., next day i called for warranty, they where very polite just asked me for the model.number and the serial number on machine got 1 back in 2 days and they even paid returned shipping. Great custommer service. Will buy another if something happens to this one. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Christian J. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Large Bowl Not Large Motor
customer_reviews.text: A lifelong KitchenAid mixer (K5SS) user I was excited to find the commercial version for my business. Upon receipt, set up and initial use, I was perplexed at the lack of power, smell and clicking noise the mixer made while in motion. It was only a matter of time that the speed began to slow down, the smell never dissipated and the unit quit working completely. I first thought it was due to overheating; however, after being left overnight, it never fired back up. Needless to say, it is on its way back in less than 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Dreffs For Success LLC

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with this model
customer_reviews.text: First let me say I am a dedicated Kitchenaid customer and have been for years. That said, this item became several years ago (and I just now thought to post a comment for customer information) very undependable, which is a disappointment because I bake for other people frequently. It stopped working in some gears, started clicking, and was totally unable to knead bread. I have had many mixers over the years and purchased this one because of its adaptable size and anticipated dependability. I have been extremely disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: JHarr

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after 2 years. Kitchenaid said I could send it in for repair at my expense. These are supposed to be commercial grade - should last beyond 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Gross

customer_reviews.title: This is very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for less than 6 months and the bearings died on it and it suddenly stopped working. This is very poor quality
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: mixer will NOT run without the guard in place.
customer_reviews.text: I think this would have been a delightful appliance BUT I order the one with the guard thinking I could remove it and only use when I needed to have it on with little people around. No where did I see that it will not even run with the guard in place. So am returning it and getting the one without the guard. I love the size of the bowl and the sturdy feel of the beaters and dough hook.
customer_reviews.author: gramma grace

customer_reviews.title: Lift arm Broken - first use.
customer_reviews.text: So i bought my wife the commercial version - because it was supposed to be the best - and hold up under trying times. The lift arm is broken in the very first use. (Pumpkin bread) We may have raised and lowered the bowl ~10 times since the box was opened (Today!) I will change my rating depending on how KitchenAid responds to my warranty request.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goeckner

customer_reviews.title: It is generally a great machine. The only problem is that it has ...
customer_reviews.text: It is generally a great machine. The only problem is that it has some difficulty kneading 7 cups of high gluten flour into bagel dough. It does the job, but struggles a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Katzman

customer_reviews.title: First use; black deposits and metal shavings in the food.
customer_reviews.text: Our old KitchenAid mixer started dropping black deposits into the food. Sent it to be repaired. Fine for a couple of months then same deposits found in the food. Very frustrating. Time for a new mixer. Decided to spend the money to upgrade to the "commercial" level model. Should be better right? First time use, black deposits in the food and what appears to be metal shavings. Seriously, at this price it should be working perfectly. Sending it back. Considering a different brand. Really, really, unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Will overheat and burn you.
customer_reviews.text: Had this mixer a month and Kitchenaid had to replace it 3 times because it kept over heating while mixing dough. The worst part was on the third product received from Kitchenaid, the planetary overheated and burned me and then started putting metal pieces and grease in my bread dough. Kitchenaid customer service was excellent at resolving the issue but this product was horrible.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Stone

customer_reviews.title: Amazing workhorse. Makes my lift bowl 6qt seem puny
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my school and it's used often to make various types of both dog and people cookies. The only bad thing about it is when I'm home and I use my 6 quart professional, it seems inferior and I wish it were commercial. This mixer is substantial and feels very sturdy. It reminds me of my mother in law's 35 year old kitchenaid (back when they were made by Hobart) and I feel it could last just as long. It will certainly outlast my teaching career.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Three, NC

customer_reviews.title: Broke after three uses
customer_reviews.text: Our classic mixer died after years of use. I thought I was being pound-wise buying a commercial grade mixer that would last forever. After three uses, it seized up and will not work. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: THIS CLAIMS TO BE 1.3 HP. NOT SURE HOW THEY MEASURE THAT, BUT IT CANNOT EVEN KNEAD 2 LBS OF BREAD DOUG AT A 53% HYDRATION . IT WOULD STALL TO A STOP ON THE LOWEST SPEED AND AT TIMES THE BOWL WOULD JUMP OFF THE LIFT MECHANISM. SEEMS TO BE A LOT CHEAPER THAN MY OLD 20 YEAR OLD KITCHEN AID STAND MIXER IT REPLACED. TOO MANY COST CUTTERS TO SAVE MONEY! SURE NOT COMMERCIAL QUALITY.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Schuchardt

customer_reviews.title: Mixer Broke Down after  First Month
customer_reviews.text: The Mixer Broke Down after 1 month used. I bought it in December 2018 but put it to use in June 2019
customer_reviews.author: Fernando L. Chapa

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Aid Mixers are Junk
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy anything from kitchen aid again. Used this several times and the motor is locked up. This was suppose to be top of line heavy duty. Kitchen Aid is not anything like it use to be. The materials and motors are made off shore or where ever they can get it cheap. Then still charge full tilt for their appliances. Hope this will be taken care of. It did not even make a year on the warranty. Bought it last of November 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for bread.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this once so far, but. . . I was able to make 2 recipes of sourdough bread at one time. My last mixer would bog down at just one recipe so that was nice. I feel the hardest part of this mixer is putting the bowl on. It did shimmy a lot on my countertop while it was kneading the bread. If I had walked away, it would have walked itself to the edge of my counter and thrown itself off the side. I am not sure yet if it was a good investment. That reminds to be seen as I use it more. Right now, the price was a bit hard to swallow.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Huwe

customer_reviews.title: heavier duty machine is a fantastic addition to my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This larger, heavier duty machine is a fantastic addition to my kitchen. I can double up my bread doughs, produce 2-3 times the Swiss Meringue and whip heavy ganache in bulk so easily now. I'm extremely pleased with the commercial mixer - I've owned a professional model KitchenAid mixer (K5) since about 1991 and the original machine still works like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: One Fat Foodie

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Aid beware!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this mixer!! When you Turn it on, it often won’t start. If you switch speeds, it’s spontaneous whether it will operate. I also purchased a Hobart and it is An amazing machine. Kitchen Aid Needs to model their engineers from Hobart.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Azinger

customer_reviews.title: great power in a perfect size!!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased and used this mixer yesterday. I will update the review after some time. I find this mixer really improved fro previews models and the power its really a ticket. I had researched a bit in this commercial size mixers and compared with other brands that hold more capacity and yet the watts and power are less. This mixers is over a horse power what makes it super amazing on bread dough or pizza. Super quiet and does not move almost nothing wen working. I do like it very much and i hope it also last long. I do recommend it !!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: but the outside of the box fine. The third beater hits the bottom AND the ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my third attempt getting this stand mixer. The first one arrived used, the second arrived in a damaged box, but decided to give it a try but it quit working after the second use and now the third one arrived with the inside box damaged, but the outside of the box fine. The third beater hits the bottom AND the side of the bowl after numerous attempts at adjusting it per instructions. UGH, I beginning to think I am not destined to have this mixer. I just want one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: but Hobart wouldn't touch it and told me that I was better off buying a new one
customer_reviews.text: I worked in food research right out of college, and I was introduced to commercial Hobart mixers. Not long after leaving that job, I bought a KitchenAid (made by Hobart back then) mixer, and it last for 40 years. I thoroughly expected to be able to take it in and have it fixed, but Hobart wouldn't touch it and told me that I was better off buying a new one. I bought an Artisan, which had minor problems from the beginning....like, the beater hitting the bowl. Suffice to say, this was not the KitchenAid of my youth. After doing research, I decided that this commercial series was the way to go, and I have not been disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Dee E. Warenycia

customer_reviews.title: Kitchenaid professional 8Qt mixer
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the 6Qt Kitchenaid mixers for over 10 yrs, but I was disappointed with the purchase of this 8Qt Kitchenaid mixer. I purchased it in Sept 2018 and by Jan 2019 it started jumping speeds and shutting off on it's own. Would put it on 1 to mix dry into wet and it takes a few seconds to start and jumps to a high speed throwing batter everywhere. This was definitely not worth what I spent on it. Kitchenaid .. can I return this mixer???
customer_reviews.author: Deborah D.

customer_reviews.title: 4 Years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Kitchenaid mixer now for over 4 years, and it is still going strong, and I use it regular! In the past 4 years, I have made over 160 custom order cakes, not to mention all of the icing and fillings that go with them. I have even made quite a few batches of marshmallows and many loaves of bread with it. The only hiccup is that it does have a ticking noise, but it isn't that loud, but it is there. Overall, she has made a great addition to her smaller sister (the Kitchenaid Mini I have to travel with) and her much older kitchenmaid sister (an original hobart kitchenaid from my mom).
customer_reviews.author: Janet Hall

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you do any significant baking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make bagels for a very small cafe we own in Ecuador. This machine has great difficulty kneading even 12 cups of flour for bagels. Very disappointed. I can make a 6-cup recipe in my normal home Kitchen Aid mixer. Why even make a larger mixer if you can't double a simple bagel recipe? If you need a heavy duty mixer, it's worth the investment to buy a 'real' commercial mixer. Kitchen Aid advertises this as a commercial mixer; it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Ster

customer_reviews.title: Heavy-duty workhorse just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the KitchenAid KSMC895NP 8-Quart Commercial Countertop Mixer in a kitchen emergency while processing many bushels of apples to make home-canned apple sauce for our pantry. My relatively new Squeezo stopped working properly. My normal duty KitchenAid Mixer seemed to be overheating. This new Commercial Countertop Mixer arrived promptly and "saved the day." After purchasing I learned that for my home-use I did not really need the guard feature. Though the Commercial Countertop Mixer is more expensive than a standard model, I am pleased after using it to process at least six more bushels of Ida Red apples. It worked like a charm, and though it gets warm, I don't have to worry about it overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money spent, for sure.
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed in my 8 qt KitchenAid. It’s supposed to be sturdy, or one would think since that’s how it’s marketed. It’s been ten months since I purchased it, and the motor sounds like it is going to give out any moment. It’s been that way for awhile. This is the second KitchenAid I have purchased with this issue. The other one lasted two years. For the money you will spend, I would not recommend it. At all. I used to love KitchenAid products, but they are obviously not built to last any more.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Loo

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this mixer
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this mixer, it replaced a 12 year old 6qt. Mixer that stopped working properly, this mixer is much quieter than the old one and we like the larger bowl very much
customer_reviews.author: James M Wingren Sr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mixer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this model for the wife after her last KitchenAid mixer began to be noisy and struggle after15 years of heavy use. She loves it. Uses it to mix everything from cake to biscotti to bread dough. It's very quiet for it's size and extremely powerful - and I get to chow down on all the goodies!
customer_reviews.author: Gig

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful mixer. I have had the 4 1/2 quart for almost 45 years and used it extensively., but this mixer is on another level. It reminds me of the KitchenAid my Mother had which incidentally still works very well. She bought hers in 1930 and this new KitchenAid is sturdy, hardworking just like the Hobart mixer which used to make KitchenAid. I couldn't wait to use it and it has not disappointed. The attachments are heavy , very sturdy and runs quite. I absolutely love and it you are a home baker that needs a large mixer this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Horn

customer_reviews.title: Power house
customer_reviews.text: I gave away my 5-quart KitchenAid because it struggled and over heated while dealing with my multigrain bread dough. This mixer no problem, does the job without complaining. The hook, paddle and whisk are top quality heavy stainless steel, forget buying the coated ones, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Edwige

customer_reviews.title: Over Paid $277 for this item.
customer_reviews.text: I did not think about Black Friday. Paid $277 more than if I had bought it from KitchenAid’s Black Friday sale that was on at the same time I purchased it from Amazon. Can’t send it back because I cut the ziplock off the plug to see if it worked when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Marx

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Mixer color is actually darker than expected, but still nice. This mixer is a dream compared to my 3 year old 5 qt Professional HD. My old mixer would over heat on me after a couple double batches of cookies. This on however is a work horse.My only complaint is that it makes a clicking type nose under any load ! I'm giving it a 4 star rating due to the noise. I hope it doesn't become a problem for me down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good medium size mixer
customer_reviews.text: This mixer fits my needs perfectly. I have a 4.5 quart residential mixer for typical use and a 20 quart Hobart for making big batches of bread. This is a good “tweener” for when I need more than one batch of bread and less than eight batches. My only complaint so far is the mixer was shown with a bowl guard, but no bowl guard was included. ?!? As a follow-up to this post, Amazon quickly responded and corrected the problem to my satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W.

customer_reviews.title: The first day we put it through it's paces
customer_reviews.text: Made a double batch of rye bread, the spiral bread hook works much better than the 20 year old Kitchen aid flat bread hook.. didn't even slow the machine down, the bowl stayed in place without a rattle.. Test one, it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: NE Plains Farm

customer_reviews.title: I like the performance of this mixer however it is difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: Have two Artesian models of Kitchen Aid stand mixers that I have been using for over 25 years and they still work well but wanted a larger bowl and more heavy duty mixer! I like the performance of this mixer however it is difficult for me to remove/replace the bowl! Also it is hard to clean and takes a while to clean with the stainless steel grid/protector! Others may not find this to be true! Needs to have a permanent home in your kitchen, because it will s very heavy to move!
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: A good step up from the 6qt if you do large ...
customer_reviews.text: A good step up from the 6qt if you do large batches. The only negative is that it is difficult to add items to the 'already mixed' ingredients as even when the bowl is in the low position, there is not much room for i.e. adding a bowl of flour to the 'cookie dough'. For some reason, I thought the top of the mixer 'might' be hinged so that it could open up and allow for easy adding of ingredients. I don't regret buying it. It was the best option.
customer_reviews.author: CBASS

customer_reviews.title: I cater and its wonderful. I can double my cookie recipe and make ...
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited with this mixer. I have made cinnamon rolls, cookies and large batches of sauces. I cater and its wonderful. I can double my cookie recipe and make 13 dozen cookies in one batch. I can make a batch of rolls with 12 cups of flour and it runs smooth. Its so quiet, the deep bowl keeps everything inside the bowl. We did a lot of research for about one year before we bought this dream machine. We were excited that the gears weren't plastic and hopefully this mixer will last a lifetime. Its costly but I think its worth the extra $$$'s. This machine makes me smile!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I've had KitchenAid mixers in the past and they just didn't do a good job kneading dough. This mixer is wonderful! So glad I purchased it. For anyone who is a professional or semi-professional chef or gourmet cook, this is the mixer for you.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Love this mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this mixer! I have had a cuisinart for more than 10 years now. I could only double a batch of cookies. With this - I can make 4 batches of cookies at 1 time! I did buy the ravioli and sausage attachments. I do NOT recommend either one. Buy a hand crank for grinding meat and buy a hand ravioli maker. This has the power for them, but the attachments really are slow. The machine itself is a workhorse. I use it at least 3 times a week!
customer_reviews.author: GnFshng

customer_reviews.title: Quite but powerful
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer. It is quite and powerful. Has been great addition to the bakery. Would love to have another one.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Bellis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bigger baking projects
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer to replace a 6qt mixer. This 8qt mixer is perfect for all my baking orders. I'm in the pastry business and have many 3 tier cake orders. Before I had to use my mixer twice to make one cake, now I use it once. The mixer is also very silent and buttons feel very sturdy. It's orange power cable it's very thick and long enough to place it on the middle of my kitchen counter. I am in love with it!
customer_reviews.author: abe

customer_reviews.title: Take the plunge!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Pro600. The difference is night and day. The extra two quart capacity is significant and the extra heavy duty construction makes it smooth and quiet. The tools are all heavy weight stainless steel and dishwasher safe. I use it for bread and heavy cookie dough and it doesn't even get warm. My old one would overheat with half the job. It hurt the wallet for a little bit, but to me it was worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ficocello

customer_reviews.title: Bakers Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Use it at least daily. Never falters or slows down. Built like the old Hobart KitchenAid mixers that lasted a lifetime. Love it! I never make a single batch of cookies. Doubles and triples. If you bake, you need this mixer. Five and seven cup units do not compare.
customer_reviews.author: D. Betz

customer_reviews.title: Commercial Mixer? Um, No.
customer_reviews.text: We used this mixer every day in our little bakery in addition to our 30-quart Hobart. The gears stripped after 2 years. Metal shavings came off when I tried to use it one day, then the gear shaft dropped down into the bowl. These are way too expensive to replace after 2 years. For home use, or very little commercial use. Boo, KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: The Foodsmith

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Aid is JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these mixers and BOTH blew up doing normal mixing. The first was a batch of icing then fondant. I am thankful I have a Hobart 20quart or I would be totally screwed right now.
customer_reviews.author: tasha miller

customer_reviews.title: waste of money.  didn't even last a year
customer_reviews.text: This mixer broke in less than a year. We bought in in November and it stopped working eight months later. Not worth $600+ for something that lasts so short of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this mixer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mixer. It's quiet and stable. It allows me to double my cookie recipes, although I occasionally get a bit of the dough on the bowl guard. However, it's fairly easy to remove to clean. The only issue I have is that you have to turn off the mixer to lift the bowl guard to add ingredients. It did come with a metal pour spout, but for the life of me, can figure out how to attach to the bowl guard. Otherwise, love this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great machine
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. Only dissappointment is that you still cannot do more than 2 loaves of bread dough due to the strain that puts on the gears.
customer_reviews.author: DrZ

customer_reviews.title: Best stand mixer ever
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best stand mixer you are going to be able to purchase works perfectly well for making all kinds of dough cookies pizza and breads the pasta attachment we purchased Works excellent I recommend this product over the smaller sizes such as the artisan or the 6 qt pro series it is worth the extra few dollars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 30 days.
customer_reviews.text: Mixer was great but after minimal use it stopped working. I now have to figure out how the warranty works. For this price it needs to last more than 30 days of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: That your iteams china made
customer_reviews.text: I buy it and its usa made but when i look inside its all china made , amazon cheat ppl
customer_reviews.author: fahadnasser

customer_reviews.title: WHAT IS  GOING OM WITH MY KITCHEN AID COMMERCIAL 8 QUART
customer_reviews.text: Greetings Mr. and Mrs. Gourmet Kitchen and Amazon Family: Just received a Kitchen Aid Commercial 8 Quart MIXER, I have tried unsuccessfully everything this side of creation and it simply WILL NOT FUNCTION. The Calder's
customer_reviews.author: MRS.  CALDER

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid Commercial
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is a little bit of heaven on earth. It handles large quantities of dough and batter with ease. It's my third KitchenAid and they all sit in a row - this is the largest and most powerful of them. I've made bread (6 loaves at once) cookies (12 dozen) and a triple batch of bundt cake batter. All mixed up beautifully and easily.
customer_reviews.author: P. Woodland

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: The mixer won't turn on, right out of the box. Returning for a refund. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: The machine arrived nicely packed. Went to work immediately, much quieter than it’s 6-Qt sibling. And twice as quick in whipping up cake and cookie batters, not to mention the increase in capacity of each batch. But to me, the biggest plus is the noise level. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauraine, TX

customer_reviews.title: Whisk attachment does not fit. Wrong size
customer_reviews.text: The whisk attachment that came with this product is not the correct size. I am unable to use whisk as it does not fit. I am unable to return this product as it has passed the return window. I will be grateful if the correct whisk attachment is sent to me. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: JOAT

customer_reviews.title: Love my 8qt KitchenAid
customer_reviews.text: I am so, so glad I ordered this. Read a lot of reviews and went back and forth trying to decide which mixer fit my needs. I had the same KitchenAid for over 30 years (it's still working....I passed it on) but I wanted something with a larger capacity. This 8qt mixer is it! It is BIG and it is HEAVY but that's fine with me. The motor is more than adequate for my needs, cakes, quick breads, yeast breads....I do a lot of scratch baking. I LOVE that it has a slow start, so no flour explosions when you start it. So far so good. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: sandra mathis

customer_reviews.title: paint chips easy, who cares, it'll work hard so you don't have to and won't wake the family running it.
customer_reviews.text: Purrs like a kitten. Even with a heavy load it purrs like a kitten, no trouble at all for it, and quiet running. Paint chips off just by looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful beast
customer_reviews.text: Just as we expected. Is being used almost daily for all the bread and pastry making during this covid quarantine
customer_reviews.author: FabMOMof3

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Cost
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer, worth every penney. I'm a home baker and it's strong enough to handle 20 cups of flour. If you bake a lot, this is a great investment. it's not cheap but I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was very disappointed in this kitchenaid product
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed in this kitchenaid product. None of the attachments actually mix to the bottom of the bowl. I mostly used the dough hook and it seemed like it was going to break every time. This just wasnt as good as I expected for kitchenaid.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: A Spectacular Mixer
customer_reviews.text: A spectacular machine. The professional model is well worth the extra money! Quiet and powerful!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Mixes Very Well
customer_reviews.text: Fairly quiet. Did a great job of mixing a cake mix. Very sturdy and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Berg

customer_reviews.title: This is the way to go for the serious baker
customer_reviews.text: I totally love this mixer. I make rolls for all the holidays and sometimes just because. The 6 quart bowl always threw flour out. This one keeps everything in the bowl. You can make ANYTHING in it. Surprisingly, it's even quieter than the 6 quart mixer! It's not for the everyday baker I suppose, but if you make large batches of cookies routinely like I do, and large batches of rolls on the holidays, it's perfect and a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, very well made.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mixer. I bake a lot of cakes. So upgrading from a 5 quart to the 8 quart was a must. Love this mixer. It's a workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Mixes and mixes. The ulitmet mid sized mixer
customer_reviews.text: A real workhorse. Will not let you down or wondering if your mixer can complete your project
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: Probably got a faulty one. 1 year of use and had to be repaired (cost over $200 to repair) had a 4 at before this and that one is still working perfectly. Unfortunately I didn't purchase the warranty as I live in the bahamas and getting back there would of been too much headache anyway
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boss.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE it. If it was any more heavy-duty, it would be a tank. Would be nice if they made a mixer blade for the larger mixers, though. Has already made lots of cakes and icings- YUM!
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Truett Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome machine that easily handles multiple bread doughs. Quiet! Excellent torque , bowl locks solidly into place. Machine did "walk"on a granite counter while kneading some heavy dough, thus stay with and watch machine during the kneading process.
customer_reviews.author: Remwoodz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mixer
customer_reviews.text: I have a 25 year old KitchenAid mixer. It works just fine but the bowl is too small for many things I make. This mixer makes any job easy. The bowl is so large you can easily double or triple a cookie recipe.
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: My wife and i do a lot of baking and love this new mixer. It replaces a Kitchenaid 5 at mixer that is over 25 years old, and is close to dying. I would recommend this mixer for someone who would use it often, otherwise a smaller (ie: 5 qt) mixer would be sufficient. This is truly a Commercial grade mixer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cooterq

customer_reviews.title: The machine works fine but is not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The machine works fine but is not as advertised. It is not NFS rated as described in the details. The photo also shows a very clear NFS certification that this machine does not have. If you are buying for a kitchen that has a health permit this is not what you need or expect.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Middle Ground For the Home
customer_reviews.text: I have had a 6 quart professional Kitchen Aid for 15 years. I'm a hobbiest baker and needed a tad more so I could knead my weekly bread bake in the bowl, rather than on the counter. This fills my knead exactly and allows me to do so much more for my family and community. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: RACHEL

customer_reviews.title: The perfect stand mixer for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks so beautiful in my kitchen! You can tell by the noise level that it's quality machine inside. Thought the safety Shield would be a pain but it's not.
customer_reviews.author: William Drake

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for a double batch
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed to make double batches of cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Allison M.

customer_reviews.title: I would really recommend this Commercial model to someone who needs a heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: I make at least four pounds of pasta and two loaves of bread every week for Sunday dinner. I kneaded (pun intended) something what would stand up to that, particularly the heavy pasta dough. I did a LOT of research and tried other mixers but none of them stood up to task. I would really recommend this Commercial model to someone who needs a heavy duty, dependable mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Marty B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: My queen!! I love it.. my dream come true!!🥰 My cakes have Better texture and are more fluffy.. better quality on my desserts 🥰💞💯
customer_reviews.author: Ana Miriam Cantu

customer_reviews.title: This is the real thing
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed. Upgrade from our Pro Kitchenaid stand mixer.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously,....
customer_reviews.text: Not to be confused with the smaller, cheaper "professional" line, this machine is big, heavy and powerful. Not for everyone, but a blessing if you do serious bread making, especially large quantities or bagels.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mathiasen

customer_reviews.title: Buy this instead of the consumer grade versions
customer_reviews.text: Much quieter and powerful than the consumer version I had before. This eases through dough and pasta so much easier and without the grinding noise. It really is worth spending the extra $. Only down side is the orange electrical cable that doesn't look great if you want to leave the unit out.
customer_reviews.author: DaveB

customer_reviews.title: Best home mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic mixer. It is hands down superior to any other home product, including anything from kitchenaid. The extra power and extra capacity are a home run. My family uses constantly and I expect it to be around for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony DJ

customer_reviews.title: It's very hard to do and at times it feels like I'm pushing hard enough to break it
customer_reviews.text: This commercial series mixer is very quiet, It mixes very well. My only issue is that I've been having problems snapping the bowl on and off the stand. It's very hard to do and at times it feels like I'm pushing hard enough to break it. Not broken so far but it hasn't gotten easier either.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Gordon

customer_reviews.title: It lasted one year and three months, but warranty service is exceptional
customer_reviews.text: It lasted one year and three months, then it broke. I've probably used it less than two dozen times. I was making egg noodles when it broke. It just...stopped. Turning it on causes it to just hum. Kitchenaid warranty service is exceptional though. My new mixer is on the way.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Colburn

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous machine
customer_reviews.text: Boom! She’s a wonderful beast of a mixer. Feeding 11 grandchildren will be so much easier now. Not my first machine. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise R. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Over priced but works well.
customer_reviews.text: Larger 8qt bowl is difficult to use, too large for stand. I suspect the 7qt would be the right size. Other wise it is what i would expect, over priced but works well.
customer_reviews.author: harold barker

customer_reviews.title: great mixer
customer_reviews.text: this is a really great mixer , especially for larger batchs - additionally the attachments are stainless steel , and it is really strong - if you bake bread this is exceptionally useful
customer_reviews.author: Richard Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Super quote and great for home bakers
customer_reviews.text: Omg I love this mixer. I’ve owned about 6 kitchen aid mixers in my baking career and I must say this is the quietest mixer I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Love the power behind this guy
customer_reviews.text: Love the power behind this guy, would have given it 5 stars however the paddle attachment does not come off easily most times I have to try and get the bowl off and then pry the paddle off:(
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bidelspach

customer_reviews.title: NSF  Commercial 8QT Mixer Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for whole wheat bread making and cookie making so far, very pleased. Noise level is very low, power level is extremely good. Very satisfied and very good purchase. Mixer arrived 2 days early in excellent condition by FedEx during the Christmas rush.
customer_reviews.author: Philip C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this mixer! I make several batches of whole wheat bread in it each week for my farmers market business and it does an outstanding job. Kitchen Aid customer service has always been great also when I’ve had a question or two.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Me newest love!*#!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this for a not-for-profit where I volunteer as a baker. The previous mixer was struggling and starting to smell like it was burning. I used "Big Red" as I affectionately call him tonight and absolutely love it - strength with stiff dough, large bowl and very quiet. I would highly recommend this mixer; wish I had one for myself!!!
customer_reviews.author: SLC

customer_reviews.title: Great value and product!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this mixer, upgraded from a 5 quart which I outgrew very quickly. Very efficient and perfect for large batches
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A. Knight

customer_reviews.title: After using this mixer for a while, handle broke ...
customer_reviews.text: After using this mixer for a while, handle broke on 8qrt mixing bowl. Handle was glued on, not welded as would appear.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love! I waited awhile to see how it held ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love! I waited awhile to see how it held up to heavy use with bread doughs and it works perfectly. The rim of the bowl is a bit sharp and should have been rolled nicer, but that's not enough of a drawback to lower it from 5 stars. My only regret is not buying it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: M.Leverich

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery....beautiful mixer. Made bread yesterday, kneaded my bread in half the time compared to my smaller kitchenAid....I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and then some
customer_reviews.text: In.love!!!!!! A far cry from Kitchenaid's horrible 6quart and under mixers. They make them with plastic gears and they are weak. This mixer is a whole different world. Heavy duty, sturdy, I can put my attachments in the dishwasher. And the 8 quart capacity is a dream!! I would highly recommend this and would buy it all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Chocjedi

customer_reviews.title: Quick transaction.
customer_reviews.text: Item was a gift for my sister. She LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best mixer ever.
customer_reviews.text: This should be six stars but I am only allowed five. Now I can mix a pound and a half cake in one mix. Gets the job done faster. Easy to use and it makes baking seems like no work at all. Love it love it love it.
customer_reviews.author: Delores

customer_reviews.title: the accessories are of better quality compared to the ones we bought at costco ...
customer_reviews.text: the accessories are of better quality compared to the ones we bought at costco years back, the metal in the accessories are shiny and heavier. The noise level is down to more than half. Very happy with the purchase. Very fast free delivery too. It was delivered about 2 days early.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great KitchenAid stand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Very useful stand mixer & surprisingly not noisy at all given the high power. Will keep using it for a long time... Just like the previous one lasted us 20 years!!😃
customer_reviews.author: Redrosy

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KSMC895DP 8-Quart Commercial Countertop Mixer with Bowl-Guard, 10-Speed, Gear-Driven, Dark Pewter
product_meta.description: Style Name:With Bowl Guard| Color:Dark Pewter8-Qt Bowl-Lift Stand Mixer, stainless steel bowl guard,1.3HP high efficiency DC motor, all-metal precise gear design, (includes: 8-quart brushed stainless steel bowl with J-style handle, stainless steel 11-wire elliptical whip, burnished stainless steel flat beater and stainless steel spiral dough hook), NSF Certified, 2-year warranty from KitchenAid, Dark Pewter
feature_bullets: Dark pewter colored base with bowl
Mix, knead and whip ingredients with ease
Bowl-lift design features quiet and robust DC motor

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars682 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
